items.title: UN Approves Global Scientific Panel on AI Impacts and Risks
items.desc: The U.N. General Assembly voted to approve a 40-member global scientific panel on the impacts and risks of AI. The 193-member assembly voted 117-2, with the United States and Paraguay voting no.

items.title: BNP Claims Landslide Victory in Bangladesh Election After 20 Years
items.desc: Bangladesh's opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party won a landmark parliamentary election, gaining at least 212 of 299 seats. Tarique Rahman is poised to become Bangladesh's next prime minister.

items.title: Trump to Announce Multi-Billion Dollar Gaza Reconstruction Plan
items.desc: President Trump will announce a multi-billion-dollar reconstruction plan for Gaza and provide details on plans for a U.N.-authorized stabilization force at the first formal meeting of his 'Board of Peace' next week.

items.title: NATO Countries Pledge Hundreds of Millions for Ukraine Weapons
items.desc: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte announced that several countries have pledged hundreds of millions of dollars for the Prioritised Ukraine Requirements List initiative to supply Ukraine with U.S. weapons.

items.title: China Completes First Maritime Recovery of Rocket First Stage
items.desc: China successfully completed its first-ever maritime recovery mission of a rocket first-stage booster. The Long March-10 carrier rocket's first stage was retrieved from the sea, marking a significant step in reusable launch vehicle technology.

items.title: China Releases Anti-Monopoly Guidelines for Internet Platforms
items.desc: China released anti-monopoly guidelines for internet platforms to help prevent collusion and unfairly high prices, state broadcaster CCTV reported.

items.title: China Reacts to CIA's New Attempt to Recruit Chinese Spies
items.desc: China responded to reports of the CIA's new attempts to recruit Chinese spies, expressing strong objections to U.S. intelligence activities targeting Chinese citizens.

items.title: China Issues New Rules to Curb Auto Price War
items.desc: China moved to curb a fierce price war among automakers that has caused big losses for the industry, after passenger car sales dropped nearly 20% in January from the year before.

items.title: Star Cruises Cancels Hong Kong Sailing, Angry Passengers Left Waiting
items.desc: Star Cruises cancelled a scheduled departure from Hong Kong on Friday evening due to an 'unforeseen technical issue', leaving angry passengers complaining they had been treated like 'refugees'.

items.title: HK Sees 25% Increase in Family Offices
items.desc: Hong Kong's appeal as a world hub for asset and wealth management continues to strengthen, with the number of single-family offices growing over 25% to more than 3,380 by late last year.

items.title: Jimmy Lai Convicted in Landmark National Security Trial
items.desc: In a landmark national security trial, a Hong Kong court convicted pro-democracy media tycoon Jimmy Lai of foreign collusion and sedition charges.

items.title: DayOne Data Lines Up Banks for $5 Billion US IPO
items.desc: Backed by Chinese data-center operator GDS Holdings, DayOne is targeting a valuation of up to $20 billion, with a listing possible as early as this year.

items.title: US Stock Market: S&P 500 Fighting to Go Green on Inflation Data
items.desc: Wall Street got relief as relatively tame inflation data spurred bigger bets on Federal Reserve rate cuts, with bond yields falling. The Dow was down about 0.13% and Nasdaq down 0.33%.

items.title: Dollar Tree Downgraded Amid Valuation Concerns
items.desc: A bank downgraded its rating of Dollar Tree stock to underperform from market perform, with a price target of $95, indicating a 26% loss from Thursday's close.

items.title: Zhipu AI Jumps 120% in China's Competitive AI Landscape
items.desc: Zhipu AI shares rose roughly 120% on strong sentiment around its product innovations, climbing to near HK$492 at peak levels, a record high for 2513.HK.

items.title: OpenAI Accuses DeepSeek of Distilling US Models to Gain Edge
items.desc: OpenAI accused DeepSeek of using distillation techniques to free-ride on capabilities developed by OpenAI and other US frontier labs, in a memo to the U.S. House Select Committee on China.

items.title: Anthropic Raises $30 Billion, Hitting $380 Billion Valuation
items.desc: Anthropic closed a record-setting $30 billion funding round, the second-largest private financing round in tech, bringing its valuation to $380 billion.

items.title: Anthropic's Super Bowl Ads Help Push Claude into Top 10 App
items.desc: Anthropic's Super Bowl commercials featuring darkly comedic scenarios helped push Claude from No. 41 to No. 7 on the U.S. App Store, its highest rank to date.

items.title: Anthropic Fast-Tracks Next Generation of Coders Into Claude Ecosystem
items.desc: Anthropic is collaborating with CodePath to integrate Claude into coding curriculum, preparing the next generation of developers for AI-native software development.

items.title: China's Zhipu Unveils New AI Model, Jolting Race With DeepSeek
items.desc: ByteDance and Zhipu have joined a flurry of Chinese companies releasing major AI model upgrades, raising the stakes in an intensifying battle for market share.

items.title: A Year on From DeepSeek Shock, More Low-Cost Chinese AI Models Coming
items.desc: One year after DeepSeek's breakthrough, several other Chinese firms are launching new products around China's Lunar New Year holiday period.

items.title: Claude AI Blackmail Scenario Reveals AI Safety Concerns
items.desc: While testing Claude 4.6 AI model, Anthropic found it was ready to assist with harmful misuse including providing support in creating chemical weapons or carrying out serious crimes.

items.title: AI Updates: Key Trends in Reasoning Models and Multimodal Capabilities
items.desc: Key trends include reasoning models (OpenAI o1, DeepSeek-R1) trading speed for accuracy, multimodal capabilities becoming standard, and efficiency improvements delivering GPT-4-level performance at lower costs.
